prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Description The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 180.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.5903, 0.021). This will position and orient the coordinate system for the current part. Generate the 2D Sketch The 2D sketch for this part is composed of two loops - loop_1 and loop_2. Loop 1 - Outer Frame Loop 1, or the outer frame, is formed by four connected lines: 1. Begin at (0.0, 0.0) and move to (0.75, 0.0). 2. Then, move from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.5903). 3. Continue from (0.75, 0.5903) to (0.0, 0.5903). 4. Finally, move from (0.0, 0.5903) back to the starting point at (0.0, 0.0). Loop 2 - Inner Details Loop 2 is made up of four connected lines: 1. Start at (0.3688, 0.0406) and move to (0.3747, 0.0406). 2. Go from (0.3747, 0.0406) to (0.3747, 0.0465). 3. Proceed from (0.3747, 0.0465) to (0.3688, 0.0465). 4. Finish at (0.3688, 0.0406) by connecting back to the start point. Transform Sketch into 3D Sketch With your sketches prepared, transform them into a 3D sketch using the previously established coordinate system. After this step, your 2D sketches will now be represented in 3D space and can be manipulated accordingly. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by a distance specified by the 'extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal' property (0.021 units). This operation converts the 2D sketches into a 3D model. To maintain the correct aspect ratio, multiply the specified 'sketch\\_scale' (0.75) across all dimensions of the shape. Description of Part 1 The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. The final length is 0.75 units, width is 0.75 units, and height is 0.021 units. Keep this shape information in mind for the assembly of the forthcoming parts.</description>

prompt: <description>**Construct the base rectangular prism (Part 1)** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, -90) and a translation vector of (0, 0.224, 0). For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and draw the following lines on it: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.0156, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.0156, 0), End Point (0.0156, 0.6667) - Line 3: Start Point (0.0156, 0.6667), End Point (0, 0.6667) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.6667), End Point (0, 0) This sketch forms a rectangle, with four lines defining its boundaries. Proceed to scale the sketch using a factor of 0.6667. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0156 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Set the sketch scale to 0.6667. The resulting part should resemble a rectangular prism leaning slightly to the right. **Construct the diagonal rectangles (Part 2)** Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles as Part 1 and the same translation vector. For the sketch, create two new faces, face\\_1 and face\\_2. On face\\_1, draw lines to form a rectangle, similar to Part 1: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.0156, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.0156, 0), End Point (0.0156, 0.6667) - Line 3: Start Point (0.0156, 0.6667), End Point (0, 0.6667) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.6667), End Point (0, 0) On face\\_2, draw the following lines to create another rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point (0.2969, 0), End Point (0.3125, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.3125, 0), End Point (0.3125, 0.6667) - Line 3: Start Point (0.3125, 0.6667), End Point (0.2969, 0.6667) - Line 4: Start Point (0.2969, 0.6667), End Point (0.2969, 0) Scale the sketch as in Part 1, using a scale factor of 0.6667. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system data. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the new body, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0 and an extrusion depth in the opposite direction of 0.0625. Set the sketch scale to 0.6667. The part will be two rectangles, angled diagonally to form a flattened pyramid shape. **Construct the central cylindrical object (Part 3)** Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0.0521, 0, 0.6667). For the sketch, create face\\_1 with a single circle defined as follows: - Circle\\_1: Center (0.1042, 0.1042), Radius 0.1042 Apply the coordinate system transformation to the 2D sketch, then extrude it in the opposite direction of the normal to generate the final 3D shape. Set the extrusion depth to 0.25 and the sketch scale to 0.2083. The part will form a central, cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom.</description>
